subject: Public Speaking
title: Mirror Neurons and Audience Feedback Loops
description: A fast breakdown of Mirror Neurons and Audience Feedback Loops for builders.

hook.text: When you see someone yawn, you yawn. When an audience sees a nervous speaker, they get uncomfortable too.

buildup.text: Mirror neurons let us simulate other people's emotions. Audiences unconsciously mirror the speaker's state.

discovery.text: If you radiate nervousness, the audience feels uneasy. Their discomfort feeds back to you, creating a loop.

twist.text: The loop works in reverse too. Project calm confidence and the audience mirrors that instead. It's contagious both ways.

climax.text: Understanding this loop is powerful: the audience wants to feel what you project. Their mood follows yours.

punchline.text: The audience is your mirror. Choose what you reflect.

quiz.question: How do mirror neurons affect public speaking?
options: Audiences unconsciously mirror the speaker's emotional state
